threatData.title: Monkey/Snake Ambush
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Ambush: They put a snake/monkey on your shoulder suddenly.
â€¢ The Extortion: They demand 200-300 DH to remove it or for the photo.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ The 2-Meter Rule: Keep a safe distance. If they approach, raise your hand and yell 'NO'.
â€¢ Price Lock: Never take a photo without agreeing on 10-20 DH total beforehand.

threatData.title: Orange Juice Roulette
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Mix: Some carts dilute juice with tap water or sugar water.
â€¢ The Ice: Huge amounts of ice made from tap water (stomach issues).
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ The Phrase: Always order 'Sans GlaÃ§on' (No Ice).
â€¢ Observation: Watch them squeeze oranges in front of you.
â€¢ Safe Stall: Stall #40 has a good reputation.

threatData.title: The Henna Grab
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Ambush: Women with syringes grab your hand and start drawing immediately.
â€¢ The Poison: 'Black Henna' often contains PPD (toxic chemical, causes burns).
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Body Shield: Keep hands in pockets. No hands = No target.
â€¢ Action: Pull away instantly and forcefully.

threatData.title: Bill Shock Standoff
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Shock: Bill is 3x or 4x expected.
â€¢ The Swarm: Waiters gather to intimidate you.
â€¢ Goal: Make you pay to escape.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Evidence: Show menu photo taken earlier.
â€¢ Calc: Do math visibly.
â€¢ Power Move: Put EXACT FAIR AMOUNT on table and leave.

threatData.title: Entrapment
threatData.description: â€¢ They place bread, water, and olives immediately on the table (not free).
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Immediate refusal. Say 'Blach' and gesture to return it. Don't touch it.

threatData.title: Phantom Bill & Touts
threatData.description:
â€¢ Menu Tricks: 'Price per 100g' or switching menus.
â€¢ Bad Stalls: Avoid Stall #117 and #1.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Safe List: Stall #14 (Fish) or #31 (Meat).
â€¢ Evidence: Photo the menu before ordering.

threatData.title: Carpet 'Cooperative'
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Setup: Claiming to be 'Government Co-op' (Lie).
â€¢ The Drama: Acting insulted if you offer low price.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Reverse Anchoring: Ask 500? Offer 50. Reset expectations.
â€¢ Walk-Away: Price drops 70% when you leave.

threatData.title: The Money Magician
threatData.description:
â€¢ Fold Under: Folding a bill underneath while counting.
â€¢ Calculator Trick: Switching to 'Euro' at payment.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Control: Count change yourself slowly.
â€¢ Clarity: Confirm 'Dirham?' before tapping card.

threatData.title: 'Government Shop' Lie
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Lie: 'Fixed Price because State-run'.
â€¢ Reality: NO government shops exist in Souks.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Action: Ignore the title. Negotiate normally or walk away.

threatData.title: The Calculator Shift
threatData.description: â€¢ Trap: Screen shows '500'. He claims it's Euros or uses '00' button to shift decimal.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Say currency out loud and check screen.

threatData.title: The Saffron Scam
threatData.description: â€¢ Trap: Selling red powder/corn silk as Saffron.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Water Test: Real saffron turns water yellow slowly. Fake turns it red immediately.

threatData.title: Fake Argan
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Lie: Selling Culinary Oil as Cosmetic.
â€¢ The Fake: Veg oil mixed with scent in clear bottles (Light destroys Argan).
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Check: Cosmetic is light gold, Culinary is dark/roasted. Must be in dark glass.

threatData.title: Road Closed Trap
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Lie: 'Road Closed' or 'Big Festival Today'.
â€¢ Goal: Make you doubt map and follow them.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Vector: Don't stop. Walk with speed.
â€¢ Sunglasses: Hide your eyes. No eye contact = No hook.

threatData.title: The Tannery Relay
threatData.description:
â€¢ The Relay: Passed from one guy to another.
â€¢ Mint Trick: Shoving mint under nose creates 'Immediate Debt'.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Protocol: Do NOT go alone. Only with licensed guide.

threatData.title: The Mellah Trap
threatData.description:
â€¢ Lie: 'Jewish Cemetery is closed'.
â€¢ Switch: Guiding you to fake 'Spice Market'.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Fact Check: Almost always open. Check Google Maps.

threatData.title: Hotel Staff Impostor
threatData.description: â€¢ Trap: Stranger claims to work at your Riad to gain trust.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Ask: 'Which hotel?' or 'What is my room number?'. He will freeze.

threatData.title: The Bill Switch
threatData.description: â€¢ Switch: You hand 200 DH. Driver drops it, swaps for 20 DH, claims mistake.
threatData.counter_measure:
â€¢ Announce: 'Here is 200'.
â€¢ Flash: Use phone light.
â€¢ Photo: Take photo of bill in hand.

threatData.title: Meter Check
threatData.description: â€¢ Lie: 'Meter broken' or fixed price demand.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Prerequisite: Say 'Turn on meter'. If refused, find another.

threatData.title: No Change Trap
threatData.description: â€¢ Trap: 'No change' for your 100/200 DH note.
threatData.counter_measure: â€¢ Prepare: Always carry coins (10, 20s). Pay exact.

intelData.page_desc: NOISE CANCELLATION. We analyzed 50+ blogs and 1000+ reviews. Targets, not options. Zero Decision Fatigue.

targets.name: Le BaromÃ¨tre
targets.intel: Underground in Gueliz. Decor resembles a giant chemistry lab. Food is excellent fusion. Smoking prohibited inside.

targets.name: Al Fassia (Gueliz)
targets.intel: Pro Tip: You MUST order the 'Lamb Shoulder' (Epaule d'Agneau) 24 hours in advance. Cannot order on spot.

targets.name: Nomad
targets.intel: Request 'Upper Terrace' when booking. Tapas-style small plates, perfect for sharing.

targets.name: Le Jardin
targets.intel: Look for turtles walking around. Pop into Norya Ayron boutique upstairs.

targets.name: Amal Center
targets.intel: Best Couscous in town (Fridays only). Non-profit supporting women.

targets.name: Fine Mama
targets.intel: Great for vegans or a break from Tagines. Rooftop has view of Koutoubia.

targets.name: ANIMA Garden
targets.intel: Free Shuttle from Koutoubia. You MUST book the shuttle online in advance.

targets.name: Jardin Majorelle
targets.intel: Critical: Tickets are ONLINE ONLY (24h in advance). Buy 'Combo' ticket to skip lines.

targets.name: Le Jardin Secret
targets.intel: Pay extra 40 DH for Tower ticket. Highest accessible point in Medina.

targets.name: Ben Youssef Madrasa
targets.intel: Go upstairs, look through student windows for unique photo angle.

targets.name: Bahia Palace
targets.intel: Skip main courtyard, head to 'Petit Riad' and Harem rooms for cedar ceilings.

targets.name: El Badi Palace
targets.intel: Don't miss underground dungeons. Terrace offers 360 panorama.

targets.name: Saadian Tombs
targets.intel: Line for main chamber is long (45m). See garden tombs while waiting.

targets.name: Jemaa el-Fnaa
targets.intel: View from 'CafÃ© Glacier' (buy drink to enter). Food stall #34 is safe.

targets.name: Ensemble Artisanal
targets.intel: Government-run. Visit HERE FIRST to learn real prices before haggling in souks.

targets.name: 33 Rue Majorelle
targets.intel: Opposite Majorelle. Fixed price. Contemporary design, not typical souk.

targets.name: The Souks (Main)
targets.intel: Start at Ensemble Artisanal to calibrate prices. Offer 50% of asking price.

targets.name: El Fenn Boutique
targets.intel: Curated by Vanessa Branson. You can visit shop even if not staying at hotel.

targets.name: Mustapha Blaoui
targets.intel: Ultimate insider spot. NO SIGN. Look for door #142-144, ring bell.

targets.name: Bacha Coffee
targets.intel: Queue is huge. HACK: Go to boutique counter for 'Takeaway' to skip wait.

targets.name: Kasbah CafÃ©
targets.intel: Top terrace for best photo of Kasbah Mosque minaret with storks.

targets.name: Shtatto
targets.intel: No Alcohol. 'Flying Hats' decor. Tricky entrance through fashion store.

targets.name: Maison Reine
targets.intel: Must order Pistachio Tart. NO Alcohol. CASH ONLY. Entrance through boutique.

targets.name: MusÃ©e Boucharouite
targets.intel: Rag Rug museum. Rooftop serves only tea/cake. Located in dead-end.

targets.name: Mythic Oriental
targets.intel: Authentic Riad vibe. Enjoy tea/pastries on terrace after.

targets.name: Les Bains de Marrakech
targets.intel: Offers Mixed/Couple Hammams. Book 'Package' (Bath+Massage).

targets.name: La Mamounia Spa
targets.intel: Most grammed pool. Book treatment to get access.

targets.name: Royal Mansour Spa
targets.intel: Enter via 'Citrus Garden'. Looks like giant white lace birdcage.

rules: Methanol Check: Smell for nail polish remover.
Sealed Rule: Stick to bottled beer/wine opened at table.
Bottle Switch: Send back open bottles immediately.
Phantom Drink: Photo menu prices before ordering.
Hostess Trap: If a 'friendly' woman orders drinks, YOU pay.
Front Door Veto: Ignore taxis waiting outside clubs.
100m Dash: Walk away to flag moving taxi.

quiet.name: El Fenn Rooftop
quiet.intel: Best sunset view without noise. Popular with artists. Drinks: Walk-in.

quiet.name: Pointbar
quiet.intel: Safe spot to blend with locals. Good music.

quiet.name: LA Pergola
quiet.intel: Fine Moroccan wines inside the Medina. Live Jazz.

quiet.name: Royal Mansour Bar
quiet.intel: Safest place in town. Zero harassment. Dress code: Chic.

quiet.name: Le Churchill
quiet.intel: 1930s vibe inside Mamounia. Strict dress code.

quiet.name: L'Envers
quiet.intel: Modern art bar in Gueliz. Young creative crowd. Safe.

quiet.name: Petanque Social Club
quiet.intel: Hidden behind old gate in Gueliz. Discreet & historic.

quiet.name: Le 68 Bar Ã  Vin
quiet.intel: French expat HQ. Best wine selection. Smoke-free areas.

quiet.name: Le BaromÃ¨tre
quiet.intel: Underground cocktail lab. Famous for 'Marrakech Market' drink.

party.name: Comptoir Darna
party.intel: Famous belly dancers. Book weeks ahead. âš ï¸ Check Bill.

party.name: Theatro
party.intel: Top club. Strict door policy. âš ï¸ Bouncer Alert.

party.name: Palais Jad Mahal
party.intel: Fire eaters & live band. Very loud. Mandatory booking.

party.name: Epicurien
party.intel: Inside the Casino. Late dinner until 4am.

party.name: Malak Emeraude
party.intel: High-end band. More local elite crowd than tourists.

party.name: The Lotus Club
party.intel: Glamorous 1930s vibe. Great steak. âš ï¸ Check Bill.

fortressData.mission_statement: Navigate Marrakech with confidence. This guide provides essential camouflage techniques, boundary-setting communication scripts, and vetted women-friendly locations. Transform from tourist to informed insider.

content.title: The Commander Walk
content.text: Predators look for 'Soft Targets'. Walk fast. Chin up. Shoulders back. Look bored. If lost, DO NOT STOP in the street. Duck into a shop.

content.title: Tech Reliance
content.text: Download Organic Maps (Offline). Google Maps fails in deep Medina. Carry a Power Bank.

scam.title: THE 'ROAD IS CLOSED' SCAM
scam.lie: A guy says: 'C'est fermÃ©!' or 'Mosque only!'. Goal: Divert you to a shop.
scam.counter: IGNORE him (Ghost Mode). CHECK map. KEEP WALKING.

red: The Tanneries (High Aggression - Never go solo)

levels.name: GHOST MODE
levels.action: Sunglasses on. No eye contact. Absolute silence.

blocks.title: The Expat Standard
blocks.do: Loose linen, maxi dresses. Cover shoulders/knees.

blocks.title: The Djellaba Hack
blocks.text: Wear a local hooded robe. Signals respect and kills the male gaze instantly.

locations.name: Amal Women's Center
locations.note: Non-profit fortress run entirely by women. 100% Safe.

locations.name: Les Bains de Marrakech
locations.note: Luxury spa sanctuary. Safe among women.

locations.name: Dar El Bacha
locations.note: Airport-grade security. Luxury coffee. Perfect for reading.

missions.title: THE BREAD PROTOCOL
missions.context: Bread is sacred ('Niama'). Locals don't bake at home; they send dough to the 'Ferran' (wood-fired oven) for a smoky taste you can't buy in stores.
steps: Prep & Mark: Knead dough. Crucial: You must 'mark' your bread with a specific knife cut or stamp so the baker recognizes it.
The Drop-off: Carry dough on a wooden board ('Wossla'). Give it to the 'Maalem' and say: 'Afak tayeb liya had lkhobz'.
The Pickup: Return in ~45 mins. Pay the small fee (1-2 DH). Carry the hot bread home carefully.
missions.tip: Etiquette: Never throw bread on the floor. If a piece falls, pick it up and kiss it (sign of respect).

missions.title: THE HAMMAM PROTOCOL
missions.context: This isn't a spa. It's a purification institution. Rich and poor sweat together. It's about shedding dead skin and social barriers.
steps: The Kit: Buy Black Soap ('Saboun Beldi'), a Rough Glove ('Kess'), and Ghassoul Clay before entry.
The Process: Enter the Warm Room first to acclimate. Apply Black Soap and sit for 15 mins to soften skin.
The Scrub (Gommage): Hire a 'Kessal'. Rinse off soap completely, then let him scrub you. Watch the 'spaghetti' of dead skin peel off.
missions.tip: Vital Etiquette: Do NOT waste water. Filling buckets endlessly is seen as disrespectful. Keep your underwear on.

missions.title: THE TANGIA PROTOCOL
missions.context: Tangia is the 'Bachelor's Dish,' cooked in the hot ashes of the Hammam furnace, not in a kitchen. It's a male-dominated craft.
steps: The Butcher: Order 'Jarret' (Shank) or 'Mokh' (Brain). Add garlic, cumin, saffron, smen, and preserved lemon. Shake the pot.
The Fernatchi: Take the sealed clay pot to the 'Fernatchi' (the ash master heating the Hammam water). He will bury it in the ashes.
The Feast: Pick it up after 4-6 hours. The meat should be 'confit' (falling off the bone). Eat communally.
missions.tip: Don't add water! The liquid comes from the meat and melting fats/butter.

missions.title: THE TAILOR PROTOCOL
missions.context: Instead of buying fast fashion, commission a 'Gandoura'. It involves picking the fabric, the embroidery ('Sfifa'), and the cut.
steps: The Fabric: Ask for 'Sousdi' (light cotton) or 'Mlifa' (winter blend). You need ~3 meters.
The Maalem: Choose your 'Sfifa' color. Ask for a 'Makhzania' cut (traditional loose fit).
The Wait: A good piece takes 24-48 hours. Don't rush art.
missions.tip: Trust the tailor's taste for color matching. They are masters of classic aesthetics.

missions.title: THE SCENT PROTOCOL
missions.context: The 'Attarine' souk is an open chemical lab. Here, you don't buy a brand; you build a scent based on your olfactory memory.
steps: The Base: Start with Musk, Amber, or Oud to anchor the scent.
The Heart & Top: Add Rose of Dades, Jasmine, or Neroli (Orange Blossom).
The Recipe: Ask the perfumer to write down the 'Recipe Card' (percentages). This is your souvenir.
missions.tip: Smell coffee beans between tests to reset your nose ('Olfactory Reset').
